Pre-Game Insights: Germany boss Julian Nagelsmann is at risk of being without both of his first-choice centre-backs for Saturday's Euro 2024 last-16 clash with Denmark at the Signal Iduna Park.
Jonathan Tah will serve a one-match ban due to picking up his second yellow card in the competition.
Antonio Rudiger may play despite being injured with a thigh issue.
Nico Schlotterbeck is expected to replace Jonathan Tah in the lineup.
Joshua Kimmich and Maximilian Mittelstadt are undisputed starters in defense.
Robert Andrich and Toni Kroos are also confirmed starters in midfield.
Ilkay Gundogan will lead the attacking midfield role.
Kai Havertz is expected to lead the attack with support from Jamal Musiala and Florian Wirtz.
